abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Education Reform Project
            for Paraguay were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            unsatisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            moderate, Bank performance was moderately unsatisfactory,
            and Borrower performance was also highly moderately
            unsatisfactory. Lessons learned include: the stability
            existing within the Ministry of Education and Culture (MEC)
            authorities throughout the entire lending and implementation
            cycles (up to August 15, 2008) created the required
            conducive environment by limiting shifts in education policy
            and implementation strategy and of changes in key
            implementation players. On the other hand, the revision and
            appropriation of the ongoing project by the new education
            authorities resulted in a temporary delay of project
            activities. Ensuring implementation readiness conditions
            prior to negotiations leads to a more effective and timely
            physical and financial execution cycle. The delays in
            physical and financial implementation experienced by this
            project, especially in the period 2004-2006, could have been
            mitigated, had the Bank team and management ensured
            appropriate implementation readiness conditions at the time
            of appraisal, especially in the case of the acquisition of
            learning goods, construction of schools and CDEs (State
            (Department) Education Council - Consejo Departamental de
            Educacion), the alternative secondary education modality and
            the in-service teacher training, just to mentioned some
            examples. The logical chain that links project activities
            and outputs to the project outcomes should be clear and
            include all factors that are present in that chain. Even
            though project outputs which are under the influence/control
            of the project have been achieved the logical chain may have
            overlooked other factors that are important to produce the
            desired project outcomes. Even though outputs have been
            achieved the desired outcome may not achieved due to
            incomplete logical chain. Cost-benefit analysis is required
            during the design of a project to avoid the inclusion of
            cost ineffective interventions like the prototype schools
            and have the appropriate technical arguments to debate
            design options.

5086769.trustfund:
TF054361-JSDF-PARAGUAY: FOSTERING SOCIAL
            CAPITAL OF THE POOR AT THE COMMUNITY LE,TF026846-PHRD-PARAGUAY: SECONDARY
            EDUCATION REFORM PROJECT

repnme.cdata!:
Paraguay - Education Reform Project :
            environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The Education Reform Project in Paraguay
            will improve the management of the educational system, and,
            provide opportunities for educational equity. This
            environmental assessment looks specifically at the potential
            environmental adversity resulting from the construction of
            schools, mainly in marginal urban areas of Asuncion, and the
            districts of Fernando de la Mora, Luque, Caaguazu, and
            Ciudad del Este, and suggests the following mitigation
            measures. Engineering designs should carefully consider
            adequate sewage treatment, and drainage systems to avoid
            water pollution, and public health hazards. Construction
            debris, and wastes should be appropriately stored in covered
            tanks until final disposal at selected landfills, in
            accordance with the country's regulations. This should
            be the contractors' responsibility, stipulated through
            precautionary clauses contained in the bidding documents.
            Likewise, the contractor shall be responsible for the
            installation of protective barriers, contouring the
            construction sites, so as to minimize air pollution, and
            noise disturbances. Traffic safety measures, such as road
            signals, and/or access roads/detours signs, should be
            established following the standard national, and
            international traffic safety measures. Deforestation should
            be avoided as possible, while re-vegetation practices should
            follow once the construction phase is completed.

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objectives of the
            Paraguay Education Reform Project are to improve: a)
            management and efficiency of the system, and b) educational
            outcomes and equity in opportunity at the secondary
            education level. There are three project components: 1)
            improves tools for educational planning and management.
            Specifically, it improves system management capacity,
            including planning and management of human resources,
            information, evaluation, and supervision systems at the
            central and state levels. This component also finances human
            resources development, including upgrading teaching and
            leadership capacity; 2) focuses specifically on secondary
            schools with an eye to improving management and quality;
            some of these initiatives will eventually be adopted by
            primary schools. This component improves educational quality
            by providing didactic materials, equipment, and training;
            and assists community-associated management by redesigning
            the institutional model for planning and management by
            introducing school development plans (PEIs) and social
            community projects with parent participation; and 3) funds
            mechanisms to provide more equitable access to secondary
            education, namely through scholarship programs for poor
            students, alternative secondary school programs for rural
            and working children, and construction of prototype schools
            in marginal urban areas.
